statements: SELECT * FROM book_sales WHERE sales_volume > 1000;
SELECT book_title, author FROM book_sales WHERE revenue < 500.00;
SELECT * FROM book_sales ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT book_title, sales_volume FROM book_sales WHERE author='JK Rowling';
SELECT author, SUM(revenue) AS total_revenue FROM book_sales GROUP BY author;
SELECT * FROM book_sales WHERE sales_volume > 1000 ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT book_title, author FROM book_sales WHERE revenue > 5000;
SELECT book_title, sales_volume FROM book_sales WHERE author LIKE '%Shakespeare%' ORDER BY sales_volume ASC;
SELECT AVG(sales_volume) AS average_sales_volume, MAX(revenue) AS max_revenue FROM book_sales;
SELECT book_title, author, revenue FROM book_sales WHERE revenue BETWEEN 2000 AND 5000 ORDER BY revenue ASC;
SELECT * FROM books;
SELECT title, author FROM books WHERE sales_volume > 100;
SELECT * FROM sales WHERE units_sold BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY sale_date DESC;
SELECT title, revenue FROM books WHERE revenue > 500.00 ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT author, sum(total_amount) AS total_sales FROM books b INNER JOIN sales s ON b.book_id = s.book_id GROUP BY author ORDER BY total_sales DESC;
SELECT * FROM books WHERE sales_volume > 100 ORDER BY title ASC;
SELECT title, author, sales_volume FROM books WHERE author = 'Jane Doe';
SELECT book_id, title, author, total_amount FROM books JOIN sales ON books.book_id = sales.book_id WHERE units_sold > 50 ORDER BY author;
SELECT SUM(units_sold) AS total_units, AVG(total_amount) AS avg_revenue FROM sales WHERE sale_date >= '2022-01-01' AND sale_date <= '2022-12-31';
SELECT DISTINCT author, COUNT(book_id) AS books_written FROM books GROUP BY author HAVING books_written >= 3 ORDER BY books_written DESC, author;
SELECT * FROM book_sales;
SELECT book_title, revenue FROM book_sales WHERE sales_volume > 100;
SELECT book_id, book_title, revenue FROM book_sales ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT * FROM book_sales WHERE revenue BETWEEN 50 AND 100;
SELECT book_title, sales_volume FROM book_sales ORDER BY sales_volume ASC;
SELECT book_title, sales_volume FROM book_sales WHERE sales_volume > 100 ORDER BY sales_volume DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT book_title, revenue FROM book_sales WHERE revenue BETWEEN 50.00 AND 100.00 ORDER BY revenue ASC
SELECT book_title, sales_volume, revenue FROM book_sales WHERE revenue > 500.00 AND sales_volume > 50 ORDER BY revenue DESC, sales_volume ASC
SELECT * FROM book_sales WHERE book_id IN (1, 3, 5) ORDER BY book_id ASC
SELECT book_title, revenue FROM book_sales WHERE revenue IS NOT NULL ORDER BY book_title
SELECT * FROM books;
SELECT title, author, genre, price FROM books;
SELECT book_id, title, author, price FROM books WHERE genre='Fiction';
SELECT * FROM sales ORDER BY sale_date DESC;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE phone IS NULL;
SELECT * FROM books WHERE price > 50 ORDER BY title DESC;
SELECT book_id, title, author FROM books WHERE genre='Fiction' AND price BETWEEN 20 AND 40 ORDER BY author;
SELECT * FROM books JOIN sales ON books.book_id = sales.book_id WHERE sales.quantity > 10 ORDER BY books.author, sales.revenue DESC;
SELECT c.name, o.order_date, s.revenue FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN sales s ON o.sale_id = s.sale_id WHERE c.email LIKE '%gmail.com' ORDER BY o.order_date ASC;

SELECT b.title, SUM(o.quantity) AS total_quantity, SUM(o.revenue) AS total_revenue FROM books b JOIN sales s ON b.book_id = s.book_id JOIN orders o ON s.sale_id = o.sale_id GROUP BY b.title HAVING total_revenue > 1000 ORDER BY total_quantity DESC;
SELECT * FROM books;
SELECT title, author FROM books ORDER BY author DESC;
SELECT genre, publish_date FROM books WHERE genre = 'Mystery';
SELECT * FROM sales WHERE quantity > 10 ORDER BY unit_price ASC;
SELECT customer_id, name, email FROM customers;
SELECT * FROM books WHERE genre = 'Fantasy';
SELECT title, author FROM books WHERE publish_date >= '2021-01-01';
SELECT MAX(unit_price) AS max_price, MIN(unit_price) AS min_price FROM sales;
SELECT b.author, COUNT(t.transaction_id) AS transaction_count FROM books b JOIN sales s ON b.book_id = s.book_id JOIN transactions t ON s.sale_id = t.sale_id GROUP BY b.author;
SELECT c.name, SUM(r.total_revenue) AS total_revenue FROM customers c JOIN transactions t ON c.customer_id = t.customer_id JOIN revenue r ON t.transaction_id = r.transaction_id GROUP BY c.name;
